Sentencas: This paper presents new steady-state and dynamic models for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) using core vector regression (CVR).
Titulo: Nonlinear multivariable modeling of solid oxide fuel cells using core vector regression

Sentencas: So far, most of conventional SOFC models have been presented based on conversion laws.
Titulo: Nonlinear multivariable modeling of solid oxide fuel cells using core vector regression

Sentencas: Due to complex mathematical equations used in these models, they are time-consuming and need large amount of memory to be applied for controller design, especially power electronic interface controller design, generation and load predictions, optimization and other studies.
Titulo: Nonlinear multivariable modeling of solid oxide fuel cells using core vector regression

Sentencas: To overcome these problems, some black-box models, such as support vector machine (SVM) and artificial neural network (ANN)-based models have been also proposed for SOFC.
Titulo: Nonlinear multivariable modeling of solid oxide fuel cells using core vector regression

Sentencas: In this paper, in order to model nonlinear multivariable behavior of SOFC two CVR-based black-box models are proposed for each operation mode, one for steady-state and the other one for dynamic modeling.
Titulo: Nonlinear multivariable modeling of solid oxide fuel cells using core vector regression

Sentencas: The proposed models are trained in a very little time and need small amount of memory in comparison with existing black-box models.
Titulo: Nonlinear multivariable modeling of solid oxide fuel cells using core vector regression

Sentencas: This is due to usage of fewer number of support vectors (SVs).
Titulo: Nonlinear multivariable modeling of solid oxide fuel cells using core vector regression

Sentencas: In order to demonstrate the efficacy of the proposed models, they are applied to a 5-kW SOFC stack.
Titulo: Nonlinear multivariable modeling of solid oxide fuel cells using core vector regression

Sentencas: Simulation results illustrate the effectiveness of the proposed models for both steady-state and dynamic studies.
Titulo: Nonlinear multivariable modeling of solid oxide fuel cells using core vector regression
